prompt.content: Based on the "Comparison of 60 Months Cumulative Total Return" graph of Tesla (TSLA) FY 2024, assume that that the common stock grows at CAGR from base period Dec-19 to Dec-24. What would be the cumulative return on Dec-28 based on the graph. Answer to the nearest whole number.

messages.content:
[{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"
Base value at Dec -19 from the chart is $100."},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"
End value at Dec-24 from the chart is 1447.97"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"
The CAGR formula is applied as: (1447.97 / 100)^(1/5) − 1"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Calculated 5-year CAGR = 70.6680% per year"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Projection formula used: Index_2028 = Index_2024 × (1 + CAGR)^4"},{"criteria":"Projected Index_2028 = 12,284.84","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"Computed cumulative return_2028 = 12,284.84 − 100 = 12,184.84%","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Final reported cumulative return (rounded to nearest whole number): 12,185%"}]
